result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott M Zwettler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Read In List filed by the District Attorney's office

Defendant Scott M Zwettler in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by victim.  Statement by James Z.

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 4 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years, Extended Supervision: 2 years) STAYED for 3 years Probation. 
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- Restitution of $1,867.00 to be paid to Jessica B. as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Court costs of $368.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 11 days jail
- Conditions of Probation: Defendant not to be in Waukesha County except for the most direct route from the jail to work.  Defendant not to be in City of Brookfield.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, Defendant to pay surcharge.
 - 6 months Condition Time (nonworking hours as of Monday, July 28, 2014) commencing FORTHWITH.  Condition time may be served in Dane County.
